articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Specific gut microbiome compositions can enhance immune checkpoint inhibitor effectiveness in urothelial carcinoma by improving immune system response.

articles.title: Lactobacillus fermentum remodeled the lung microbiota by crosstalk with the gut and lungs and regulated the PI3K-AKT pathway to alleviate acute lung injury.
articles.summary: Lactobacillus fermentum reduced lung inflammation and injury by rebalancing gut and lung microbiota and suppressing a key inflammatory pathway.

articles.title: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene suppresses prostate cancer via apoptosis and autophagy in vitro and potent tumor growth inhibition in vivo.
articles.summary: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene effectively suppresses prostate cancer by inducing cancer cell death through coordinated apoptosis and autophagy mechanisms.

articles.title: Discovery of a Covalent Small-Molecule eEF1A1 Inhibitor via Structure-Based Virtual Screening.
articles.summary: A novel small molecule inhibitor (AKOS-04) targeting the protein eEF1A1 shows promising potential for pancreatic cancer treatment through covalent binding.

articles.title: [Evaluation of long-term prognosis of gastric cancer patients by tumor textbook outcome and analysis of related factors].
articles.summary: In gastric cancer patients, achieving textbook oncologic outcome (TOO) after surgery was associated with significantly better long-term survival rates.

articles.title: Protective effect of Rosmarinus officinalis and its nanoparticles against chemobrain and neuroinflammation in rats: involvement of Wnt/β-catenin signaling and apoptotic machineries.
articles.summary: Rosmarinus officinalis extract and nanoemulsion protected rats from oxaliplatin-induced chemobrain by reducing neuroinflammation and preserving cognitive function.

articles.title: Glutathione-activatable bola dendrimers mediate tumor-specific cytosolic siRNA delivery via dynamic thiol-disulfide exchange.
articles.summary: Glutathione-responsive bola dendrimers successfully delivered siRNA to lung cancer cells, inhibiting tumor growth with minimal side effects.

articles.title: Impact of renal and hepatic function on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase phenotype assessed by enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and uracilemia.
articles.summary: A study found that kidney and liver problems can affect enzyme activity related to how the body processes certain cancer drugs, potentially impacting treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Clinical Implications of Aberrant Retinoblastoma Signaling in Patients With Grade 4 IDH-Mutant Astrocytoma: A Retrospective Cohort Study.
articles.summary: A disruption in retinoblastoma cell signaling is linked to shorter survival in patients with grade 4 IDH-mutant brain astrocytoma.

articles.title: Scaling the glassy dynamics of active particles: Tunable fragility and reentrance.
articles.summary: Self-propelled particles in dense assemblies exhibit complex dynamic behaviors that could provide insights into biological processes like cancer progression.

articles.title: Bioresponsive immunomodulator nanocomplex for selective immunoengineering in metastatic lymph nodes.
articles.summary: A targeted nanocomplex selectively reprograms immune responses in metastatic lymph nodes, activating T cells and inhibiting tumor growth in mouse models.

articles.title: Caspase-3 cleaves and activates the NADase SARM1 to promote apoptosis, linking two cell death mechanisms.
articles.summary: Caspase-3 activates SARM1, a metabolic enzyme, during cell death in neuroblastoma and immune cells, potentially linking apoptosis and neurodegeneration.

articles.title: Network toxicology and Mendelian randomization reveal pathogenic factors of monoethyl phthalate-induced thyroid cancer.
articles.summary: Network toxicology and genetic analysis identified five key genes that may explain how monoethyl phthalate exposure could contribute to thyroid cancer development.

articles.title: Deciphering the CAF-LCN2 axis: Key to overcoming anti-PD-L1 immunotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts in lung cancer promote therapy resistance by increasing LCN2 levels, and silencing LCN2 can improve immunotherapy effectiveness.

articles.title: Natural compound 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone mitigates radiation-induced lung injury by suppressing EMT and PI3K/Akt pathway.
articles.summary: A natural compound called 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone effectively reduces lung inflammation and fibrosis after radiation exposure by blocking key cellular signaling pathways.

articles.title: Force coordination distinguishes epithelial and mesenchymal modes of collective chemotaxis.
articles.summary: Neural crest cells migrate differently in epithelial and mesenchymal states, with distinct supracellular force coordination and traction mechanisms during collective chemotaxis.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: The review tracks the growing antibody therapeutic pipeline, highlighting 209 late-stage candidates with potential regulatory review in 2026, predominantly for non-cancer indications.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by influencing immune cell interactions and reducing tumor progression.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Herbal treatment Gushen Antai showed potential for improving early pregnancy outcomes in IVF patients by modulating immune system markers.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary: In urothelial cancer, manipulating the gut microbiome through transplantation, probiotics, or diet may enhance immunotherapy effectiveness by boosting immune system response.

articles.title: Effects of estradiol, tamoxifen, and raloxifene on human temporal lobe cortex astroglial cell spreading.
articles.summary: Estradiol and two breast cancer drugs (tamoxifen and raloxifene) affect how brain support cells spread and change shape in the temporal lobe.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear summary sentence:

Manipulating gut bacteria may improve immune checkpoint inhibitor responses in urothelial carcinoma by enhancing the body's immune system function.

articles.title: The colloidal stability of albumin-based drug delivery systems has a profound effect on tumoricidal activity.
articles.summary: Researchers developed improved albumin-based nanoparticles with better colloidal stability, leading to enhanced paclitaxel drug delivery and increased tumor exposure in cancer treatment.

articles.title: Gut microbiome remodeling induced by microplastic exposure in humans.
articles.summary: Microplastic exposure alters gut microbiome composition, increasing potentially harmful bacteria and reducing beneficial microbes that produce protective fatty acids.

articles.title: NK cell-mediated tumor cell killing by bispecific innate cell engagers induces ADCC-mediated activation of primary human dendritic cells.
articles.summary: Bispecific antibodies targeting NK cells can activate dendritic cells, potentially enhancing the immune response against tumors by priming T cell responses.

articles.title: Mucin-degrading gut bacteria: context-dependent roles in intestinal homeostasis and disease.
articles.summary: Mucin-degrading gut bacteria like Akkermansia muciniphila play complex, context-dependent roles in gut health and disease by modulating microbial ecosystems and host responses.

articles.title: Effect of Ileal Feces Transplantation in Preventing Diversion Colitis and Its Complications Due to Protective Loop Ileostomy in Rectal Cancer Cases.
articles.summary: Fecal transplantation significantly reduced inflammation and tissue damage in patients with rectal cancer who underwent protective loop ileostomy.

articles.title: Development and validation of a predictive model for high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with ICIs.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a predictive model using biomarkers to identify high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by enhancing immune response and offering a promising plant-based therapeutic approach.

articles.title: Engineering nanobodies for drug delivery systems in Alzheimer's disease.
articles.summary: Nanobodies can cross the blood-brain barrier and target Alzheimer's disease proteins, showing promise for developing new therapeutic strategies.

articles.title: Discovery of novel and highly potent XIAP-targeted peptide inhibitors using virtual screening.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered a novel peptide (Peptide-5) that effectively inhibits lung cancer cell growth by targeting XIAP protein with high binding affinity and minimal toxicity.

articles.title: Evaluation of the immunotoxicity of atrazine and its chloro-metabolites: relevance for human cancer.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Atrazine, a common herbicide, appears unlikely to cause significant immune system damage or increase cancer risk at typical human exposure levels.

articles.title: Identification and biological evaluation of benzimidazole-based compounds as novel TGFβR1 inhibitors.
articles.summary: Researchers identified a novel benzimidazole compound (3282-0486) that effectively inhibits TGFβR1 and reduces colorectal cancer cell migration and survival.

articles.title: Clinical characteristics and whole exome sequencing in JAK2V617F- and CALR-unmutated essential thrombocythemia.
articles.summary: In patients with essential thrombocythemia lacking known mutations, whole-exome sequencing revealed previously unidentified genetic drivers of the disease.

articles.title: Elevated C-reactive protein to albumin ratio is a promising predictive biomarker for prognosis in patients with renal cell carcinoma.
articles.summary: High levels of inflammation markers (C-reactive protein to albumin ratio) can predict worse outcomes for patients with kidney cancer.

articles.title: Environmental tobacco smoke exposure and pelvic inflammatory disease: a cross-sectional analysis of serum cotinine.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Exposure to secondhand smoke, as measured by serum cotinine levels, was associated with increased risk of pelvic inflammatory disease in non-smoking women.

articles.title: The P7 peptide antagonizes bFGF-induced malignant behaviors of ovarian cancer by inhibiting MEK/ERK signaling pathway.
articles.summary: A novel P7 peptide blocks basic fibroblast growth factor's ability to promote ovarian cancer cell growth and spread by interrupting key signaling pathways.

articles.title: Human papillomavirus vaccinations' association to childbirth rates.
articles.summary: HPV vaccination did not negatively impact childbirth rates, but may have delayed pregnancy due to sexual health counseling received during screening.

articles.title: Frequency-adjusted daratumumab-based regimen versus bortezomib/dexamethasone in newly diagnosed AL amyloidosis: a matched-cohort study.
articles.summary: A frequency-adjusted daratumumab regimen showed promising results compared to standard treatment for patients with newly diagnosed AL amyloidosis.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: Research tracks the growing pipeline of antibody therapeutics, highlighting 209 late-stage candidates with potential regulatory review in 2026, mostly for non-cancer conditions.

articles.title: Endobronchial ultrasound-guided mediastinal biopsies for the diagnosis of mediastinal diseases: A network meta-analysis.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

A comprehensive review of diagnostic techniques suggests endobronchial ultrasound is highly effective for evaluating mediastinal conditions and lung cancer staging.

articles.title: Clinical effectiveness and impact of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccines in preventing invasive pneumococcal disease among children with risk conditions: A systematic literature review.
articles.summary: PCV13 vaccine showed high effectiveness (83.8-91%) in preventing invasive pneumococcal disease among children with various immunocompromising conditions like sickle cell disease and cancer.

articles.title: Independent prognostic factors predicting survival in multiple myeloma patients post-chemotherapy: a retrospective study.
articles.summary: Low platelet count and high lactate dehydrogenase levels significantly predict shorter survival in multiple myeloma patients after chemotherapy treatment.

articles.title: Leukemia-derived exosomes induce immunosuppression of dendritic cell function via TGFB2-MRPL58 axis.
articles.summary: Leukemia exosomes suppress immune responses in dendritic cells by using a specific molecular pathway, potentially hindering the body's ability to fight cancer.

articles.title: Smartphone-Enabled Cough Detection in Severely Exacerbated COPD: An Exploratory Pilot Study.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a smartphone app that can detect cough patterns in COPD patients to help monitor disease progression and potential exacerbations remotely.

articles.title: Investigation of exercise-mimetic bioactive molecules as modulators of MMP activity and expression in cancer cells.
articles.summary: Certain exercise-mimetic compounds like Icariin and Berberine show promise in inhibiting lung cancer cell growth by targeting matrix metalloproteinases.

articles.title: Berberine derivative C51 modulates cGAS-STING-TIM-3 axis to reverse immune evasion and inhibit lung cancer growth.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative, C51, effectively inhibits lung cancer growth by modulating immune pathways and reversing cancer cells' ability to evade immune detection.

articles.title: Zinc(II)-berberine-based complexes targeting mitochondria exhibit enhanced antiproliferative activity as single drugs or in combination with ABT-199.
articles.summary: Zinc(II)-berberine complexes BerT1 and BerT3 effectively target mitochondrial Mcl-1 protein, inhibiting breast cancer cell growth and inducing apoptosis.

articles.title: The advancements in targeted therapeutic strategies for breast cancer via intervention of natural molecules: An insight into cellular and molecular mechanisms.
articles.summary: Natural compounds like curcumin and resveratrol show promise in targeting breast cancer by modulating oncogenic signaling, promoting cancer cell death, and enhancing treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Genome-wide CRISPR screening identifies CLDN1 as a central node in the anticancer mechanisms of berberine and as a therapeutic target in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Genome-wide CRISPR screening revealed CLDN1 as a key gene influencing berberine's anticancer effects in lung cancer cells, potentially offering a new therapeutic target.

articles.title: Nanoparticle-based approaches for doxorubicin delivery in hepatocellular carcinoma: Current strategies and emerging innovations.
articles.summary: Nanoparticle-based drug delivery strategies can enhance doxorubicin effectiveness and overcome resistance mechanisms in hepatocellular carcinoma treatment.

articles.title: Integrated lipidomics and Chinmedomics reveal the multi-target mechanism of Phellodendri Amurensis Cortex in prostate cancer via lipid metabolism remodeling.
articles.summary: Phellodendri Amurensis Cortex shows promise in targeting prostate cancer by disrupting cancer cell lipid metabolism and transforming the tumor environment.

articles.title: Experimental and clinical insights into the therapeutic potential of Berberis vulgaris and its bioactive constituents in respiratory, allergic, and immunological disorders: a comprehensive review.
articles.summary: Berberis vulgaris shows potential in reducing inflammation and modulating immune responses in respiratory disorders, with promising anti-inflammatory effects demonstrated in experimental and clinical studies.

articles.title: A CD36-Targeting Thermosensitive Berberine Nanogel Blocks Tumor Lipid Hijacking and Potentiates Anti-PD-L1 Immunotherapy in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer.
articles.summary: A thermosensitive nanogel delivering berberine targets CD36 in triple-negative breast cancer, reducing lipid accumulation and enhancing immunotherapy effectiveness.

articles.title: A novel photosensitizer berberine derivative B12 induces apoptosis and suppresses HIF-1α expression in colorectal cancer cells via mitochondria-to-nucleus sequential-targeting.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative B12 effectively targets and kills colorectal cancer cells by generating reactive oxygen species under hypoxic conditions through photodynamic therapy.

articles.title: FOXO: a key target in regulating aging and age-related diseases.
articles.summary: FOXO transcription factors regulate aging by controlling cellular processes like metabolism, stress response, and autophagy, potentially mitigating age-related diseases.

articles.title: Computational evaluation of berberine derivatives as potential modulators of TGF-β signalling in cancer.
articles.summary: Computational research identified modified berberine derivatives that could potentially disrupt TGF-Î² signaling and improve cancer treatment by enhancing receptor interactions.

articles.title: High-fat Diet-associated Digestive Cancers: Mechanisms, Natural Product-based Therapies, and Drug Development.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Natural compounds from Traditional Chinese medicine show promise in preventing and treating digestive cancers linked to high-fat diets.

articles.title: Berberine overcomes paclitaxel resistance in triple-negative breast cancer by inhibiting HSP90-mediated BRCA1 phosphorylation.
articles.summary: Berberine enhances paclitaxel's effectiveness in triple-negative breast cancer by targeting a protein that helps cancer cells resist treatment.

articles.title: Evaluation of the obesogenic role of betel nut extract in mice and its remediation by berberine and orlistat.
articles.summary: Berberine and orlistat effectively countered betel nut extract-induced obesity and metabolic disruptions in mice, with berberine showing superior results.

articles.title: A Natural LDHA Allosteric Inhibitor Geraniin Suppresses Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Cell Growth.
articles.summary: Geraniin, a natural compound, effectively inhibits triple-negative breast cancer cell growth by targeting a key metabolic enzyme and disrupting cancer cell processes.

articles.title: LITAF-NOTCH2-Bmi-1 Axis Mediates AMPK-Dependent Inhibition of Gastric Cancer Invasion and Metastasis.
articles.summary: In gastric cancer, AMPK activation suppresses tumor spread by upregulating LITAF, which inhibits Bmi-1 through NOTCH2, reducing cancer cell invasion and progression.

articles.title: Integrative Multi-Omics Analysis and Experiments Validation Identify COX5B as a Novel Therapeutic Target for Lung Adenocarcinoma.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered that COX5B could be a promising new treatment target for lung adenocarcinoma, potentially offering hope for patients who do not respond to current therapies.

articles.title: Anticancer, Anti-Inflammatory, and Acute Toxicological Evaluation of the Novel Berberine Derivative BN-7.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative (BN-7) demonstrated potent anticancer effects against non-small cell lung cancer cells and significant anti-inflammatory properties.

articles.title: RAGE signaling pathway in glioblastoma and cognitive decline: Insights into inflammatory mechanisms and therapeutic implications.
articles.summary: By targeting the RAGE signaling pathway, researchers found a potential strategy to simultaneously slow glioblastoma progression and reduce radiation-induced cognitive decline.

articles.title: Structural and functional insights into targeting hTERT G-quadruplex by levo-Tetrahydropalmatine in the non-small cell lung cancer.
articles.summary: Levo-tetrahydropalmatine and its derivatives effectively bind to the hTERT G-quadruplex, suppressing telomerase expression and inhibiting non-small cell lung cancer growth.

articles.title: Bovine serum albumin modified carbon dots and berberine composite promotes tumor mitochondrial dysfunction and apoptosis.
articles.summary: BSA-modified carbon dot-berberine nanocomposite effectively targets tumor mitochondria, induces cell death, and inhibits cancer growth with minimal side effects.

articles.title: A comparative analysis of bioactive phytochemicals in Cynanchum viminale (L.) L. and Pergularia daemia (Forssk.) Chiov. from Saudi Arabian folk medicine.
articles.summary: Cynanchum viminale showed potent cytotoxicity against liver cancer cells by targeting the EGFR protein, with alkaloids demonstrating high-affinity binding to disrupt cancer cell growth.

articles.title: The role of Chinese medicines in targeting non-coding RNAs to overcome cancer drug resistance: Mechanisms and clinical translation challenges.
articles.summary: Chinese medicines show promise in targeting non-coding RNAs to overcome drug resistance in cancer by modulating cellular plasticity and signaling pathways.

articles.title: Design, synthesis and anti-breast tumor activity of Berberine hydrogen sulfide donor derivatives.
articles.summary: Researchers developed modified berberine compounds that release hydrogen sulfide and show strong anti-breast cancer activity against MCF-7 and 4T1 tumor cells.

articles.title: Berberine's impact on health: Comprehensive biological, pharmacological, and nutritional perspectives.
articles.summary: Berberine shows promise in treating multiple conditions, including inhibiting tumor growth, reducing colorectal adenoma recurrence, and improving metabolic and cardiovascular health.

articles.title: Inhibitory potential of phytochemicals on species-specific breast cancer resistance protein transport activity.
articles.summary: Certain phytochemicals like apigenin and kaempferol can significantly inhibit breast cancer resistance protein transport across multiple species.

articles.title: Excipient-free self-assembled nanotheranostics enable synchronous sensitization of tumoricidal photothermal and photodynamic therapies through mitochondrial metabolic intervention.
articles.summary: Researchers developed nanoparticles combining metabolism-targeting drugs and a photosensitizer to enhance cancer treatment effectiveness by disrupting tumor cell energy production and oxygen dynamics.

articles.title: Study on the mechanism of action of berberine combined with Jianpi Yishen Huazhuo formulation in treating obese polycystic ovary syndrome by activating PI3K/AKT signaling pathway.
articles.summary: The combination of berberine and a Chinese herbal formulation may improve polycystic ovary syndrome in obese rats by enhancing cellular signaling pathways.

articles.title: Targeting Ferroptosis in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma: Mechanisms, Resistance, and Precision Therapeutic Opportunities.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

In nasopharyngeal carcinoma, targeting ferroptosis mechanisms can potentially overcome therapy resistance by modulating cell death pathways linked to viral infection.

articles.title: Network pharmacology of natural alkaloids: Rewiring the vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear summary sentence:

Natural alkaloids show potential to break the self-reinforcing cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction that contributes to chronic disease progression.

articles.title: Jiao-tai-wan and its component coptisine attenuate PCOS by regulating mitochondrial cholesterol import through suppression of SIRT1 ubiquitination.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Traditional herbal treatment Jiao-tai-wan reduces symptoms of polycystic ovary syndrome by improving mitochondrial function and cellular metabolism.

articles.title: Coptisine regulates PI3K/AKT pathway to block bladder cancer progression: a study based on network pharmacology, in vitro and in vivo assays.
articles.summary: Coptisine, a natural compound, inhibits bladder cancer cell growth by targeting the PI3K/AKT pathway, reducing tumor progression and malignant behaviors.

articles.title: AI-guided design of a CXCR4-targeted core-shell nanocarrier for co-delivery of berberine/paclitaxel in cancer therapy.
articles.summary: AI-designed nanoparticles co-delivering two cancer drugs show promising colorectal cancer therapy by selectively targeting and shrinking tumors without toxic side effects.

articles.title: Plant-derived immunomodulators in cancer: Balancing immune activation and suppression within the tumor microenvironment.
articles.summary: Plant-derived compounds like piperlongumine, berberine, and EGCG show potential to modulate immune responses in cancer by targeting checkpoint proteins and T cell function.

articles.title: Machine learning-powered discovery of a novel berberine derivative inducing SCD-dependent ferroptosis in osteosarcoma.
articles.summary: A new berberine-based drug identified through machine learning effectively kills osteosarcoma cancer cells by triggering a specific type of cell death.

articles.title: Berberine-cucurbit[7]uril complex boosts the antitumor effect of berberine.
articles.summary: A cucurbit[7]uril-berberine complex significantly improved berberine's cancer-fighting ability by enhancing its effectiveness against tumor cells.

articles.title: Berberine sensitizes liver cancer cells to sorafenib by inducing SETDB1/NQO1/p53-dependent ferroptosis and genomic instability.
articles.summary: Berberine enhances sorafenib's effectiveness against liver cancer by triggering cell death through ferroptosis and genomic instability mechanisms.

articles.title: LC-MS/MS based cellular pharmacokinetics to explore the mechanism of palmatine against doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity.
articles.summary: Palmatine reduces doxorubicin's cardiotoxicity by inhibiting drug transport proteins, thereby decreasing the chemotherapy drug's accumulation in heart cells.

articles.title: Potential Health Effects of the Natural Alkaloid Berberine: A Narrative Review.
articles.summary: Berberine, a natural plant compound, shows potential in targeting multiple diseases, including cancer, by exhibiting antitumor and anti-inflammatory properties across various biological pathways.

articles.title: Berberine Induces Ferroptosis and Impairs Migration via Glutathione Peroxidase4/Six-transmembrane Epithelial Antigen of Prostate3 Signaling Pathway in Oral Cancer Cells.
articles.summary: Berberine effectively triggers cell death and reduces movement in oral cancer cells by targeting a specific cellular pathway.

articles.title: AI-based prediction of drug-gene interactions modulating tight junction integrity: A deep learning framework highlighting multiple therapeutic targets.
articles.summary: An AI-powered deep learning model can predict how drugs interact with genes to potentially disrupt or restore the cellular barrier integrity in various diseases.

articles.title: A comprehensive review of alkaloids in cancer therapy: focusing on molecular mechanisms and synergistic potential of piperine in colorectal cancer.
articles.summary: Piperine, a black pepper alkaloid, shows promising potential in colorectal cancer by inducing cell death, blocking cancer pathways, and enhancing treatment effectiveness when combined with other therapies.

articles.title: Investigation of phytoconstituents interactions with human Src kinase in a bid to improve cholangiocarcinoma chemotherapy: An in-silico approach.
articles.summary: Apigenin, a plant compound, shows promise as a potential drug for cholangiocarcinoma by effectively interacting with the Src protein and demonstrating stable molecular dynamics.

articles.title: Optimizing blood-brain barrier permeability: the effect of wine processing on alkaloids in Phellodendri Chinensis Cortex.
articles.summary: Wine processing of Phellodendri Chinensis Cortex significantly improves blood-brain barrier permeability of key alkaloids, potentially enhancing brain drug delivery mechanisms.

articles.title: Thyroid cancer: From molecular insights to therapy (Review).
articles.summary: Molecular insights reveal distinct genetic and metabolic alterations across thyroid cancer subtypes, guiding targeted therapies and personalized diagnostic strategies.

articles.title: Sirtuins as mediators and targets of arsenic toxicity: unraveling signaling pathway crosstalk.
articles.summary: Sirtuins may help mitigate arsenic-induced cellular damage by restoring antioxidant defenses and metabolic function, particularly in acute promyelocytic leukemia.

articles.title: Computational analysis of ligands from natural products on the cellular targets of combined hepatocellular carcinoma and cholangiocarcinoma.
articles.summary: Gossypol and berberine from natural plants show promising potential as targeted therapies for combined hepatocellular and cholangiocarcinoma by effectively binding to multiple cell receptors.

articles.title: Potential of Apigenin, Berberine, Chrysin, and Luteolin to Overcome Doxorubicin Resistance in Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia HL-60 Cells.
articles.summary: Apigenin, Chrysin, and Luteolin can help overcome drug resistance in acute promyelocytic leukemia by targeting a key cellular resistance mechanism.

articles.title: Berberine-loaded mesoporous silica nanomaterials inhibit pancreatic cancer targeting cancer stem cells.
articles.summary: Nanoparticles carrying berberine effectively targeted and reduced pancreatic cancer stem cells, demonstrating potential for improved treatment of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

articles.title: Berberine alleviates the proliferation and metastasis of ESCA by promoting CCDC18-AS1 expression based on bioinformatics and in vitro experimental verification.
articles.summary: Berberine reduces esophageal cancer cell growth and spread by increasing CCDC18-AS1 expression, potentially improving patient outcomes.

articles.title: Berberine Hydrochloride Inhibits the Proliferation and Tumorigenesis of Hepatocellular Carcinoma Cells by Regulating Amino Acid Metabolism.
articles.summary: Berberine hydrochloride suppresses liver cancer cell growth by disrupting amino acid metabolism, potentially offering a non-toxic therapeutic approach.

articles.title: Berberine suppresses colorectal cancer progression by inducing ferroptosis-mediated energy metabolism disorders.
articles.summary: Berberine disrupts colorectal cancer cell metabolism and triggers cell death by inducing ferroptosis, potentially offering a new treatment approach.

articles.title: Unveiling Berberine's Therapeutic Mechanisms Against Hepatocellular Carcinoma via Integrated Computational Biology and Machine Learning Approaches: AURKA and CDK1 as Principal Targets.
articles.summary: Berberine shows promise in targeting AURKA and CDK1 to disrupt hepatocellular carcinoma cell cycle progression, potentially offering a new therapeutic approach for liver cancer.

articles.title: Joint multi-technology applications for etablishing quality evaluation model of Coptidis Rhizoma.
articles.summary: A new method using chromatography and spectroscopy can quickly detect key compounds in Coptidis Rhizoma that show potential for treating oral squamous cell carcinoma.

articles.title: Targeting Key Molecular Mechanisms in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Therapies with Natural Compounds.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Natural compounds show promise in targeting molecular pathways to potentially improve treatment options for aggressive triple-negative breast cancer.

articles.title: Nano-phytochemical-based formulations as promising opportunities for prostate cancer therapy and management: a comprehensive narrative review.
articles.summary: Nanotechnology enhances phytochemicals' ability to target, kill, and prevent the spread of prostate cancer cells more effectively and with fewer side effects.

articles.title: Berberine: a promising strategy to combat cetuximab-resistance in colorectal cancer.
articles.summary: Berberine combined with cetuximab enhances colorectal cancer cell death by inhibiting key cellular pathways and reducing resistance to treatment.

articles.title: Regulating arachidonic acid metabolism: a novel strategy to prevent colorectal inflammatory cancer transformation.
articles.summary: A novel nanoplatform targeting arachidonic acid metabolism effectively triggers immune responses and reduces inflammation, potentially preventing colorectal cancer progression.

articles.title: Synergistic apoptotic effects of berberine and hesperidin co-encapsulated in PLGA nanoparticles on lymph node carcinoma of prostate cell line.
articles.summary: Berberine and hesperidin nanoparticles effectively reduced prostate cancer cell viability and induced apoptosis, showing promising potential as a targeted cancer treatment.

articles.title: Multiple target and regulatory pathways of berberine.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary highlighting the key finding:

Berberine, a traditional Chinese medicine compound, shows potential in targeting multiple molecular pathways to inhibit tumor growth and treat various diseases.

articles.title: Herbal Medicine for Colorectal Cancer Treatment: Molecular Mechanisms and Clinical Applications.
articles.summary: Herbal medicines like curcumin and resveratrol show potential to suppress colorectal cancer growth through multiple molecular mechanisms.

articles.title: Endoplasmic Reticulum Stress and Liver Cancer: Regulation Through Natural Products.
articles.summary: Natural compounds like curcumin and resveratrol can modulate endoplasmic reticulum stress to promote liver cancer cell death and improve treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Berberine and Lung Cancer: From Pure Form to Its Nanoformulations.
articles.summary: Nanoformulations of berberine show promise in improving lung cancer treatment by enhancing the compound's bioavailability and anticancer effectiveness.

articles.title: Combination of Berberine and NVP-BEZ235 inhibits metastasis of triple-negative breast cancer MDA-MB-231 cell line.
articles.summary: Combining berberine and NVP-BEZ235 effectively inhibits migration and growth of triple-negative breast cancer cells, showing promise for targeted treatment.

articles.title: Multi-omics profiling identifies berberine and salidroside as potential immunoregulatory compounds in radiation-induced skin injury.
articles.summary: Berberine and salidroside show promise in reducing inflammation and tissue damage caused by radiation exposure in skin, potentially improving patient outcomes.

articles.title: Berberine for preventing colorectal adenoma recurrence and neoplasm occurrence: 6-Year follow-up of a randomized clinical trial.
articles.summary: Berberine significantly reduced colorectal adenoma recurrence and new neoplasm occurrence for up to 6 years after initial treatment.

articles.title: Mitochondrial Calcium Uniporter Links Acetyl-CoA Metabolism and H3K27 Acetylation to Maintain Glioblastoma Stem Cells.
articles.summary: In glioblastoma stem cells, the mitochondrial calcium uniporter (MCU) drives cell survival by linking metabolism to gene expression through acetyl-CoA and histone acetylation.

articles.title: Berberine: A Bitter Phytochemical With Diversely Sweet Therapeutic Properties.
articles.summary: Berberine, a plant-derived compound, shows promise in managing multiple health conditions, particularly diabetes, by improving metabolic functions and reducing inflammation.

articles.title: Molecular mechanisms underlying cyclophosphamide-induced ovarian injury and protective strategies.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Cyclophosphamide can cause ovarian damage through inflammatory and oxidative stress mechanisms, with potential protective strategies involving antioxidant and anti-inflammatory compounds.

articles.title: Revisiting berberine for the prevention and treatment of Fusobacterium nucleatum-induced colorectal cancer from a dynamic perspective.
articles.summary: Berberine shows promise in preventing and treating colorectal cancer by disrupting Fusobacterium nucleatum's progression and blocking its cancer-promoting mechanisms.

articles.title: Alginate/sodium carboxymethyl cellulose nanocomposite hydrogels loaded with berberine-rosmarinic acid nanoparticles: pH-responsive release for enhanced acid stability and colon-targeted delivery.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a nanocomposite hydrogel delivery system that enhances berberine and rosmarinic acid's anticancer effects in colorectal cancer by improving stability and targeted release.

articles.title: Berberine pharmacological properties and therapeutic potential across cancer, digestive, metabolic, cardiovascular, and neurological diseases: an update review.
articles.summary: Berberine, a plant-derived compound, shows promising anti-cancer potential by modulating metabolism, immune responses, and cellular functions across multiple disease systems.

articles.title: Berberine Sensitises Breast Cancer Cells to Radiation via the Attenuation of DNA Ligase III.
articles.summary: Berberine enhances radiation's effectiveness in triple-negative breast cancer by reducing DNA repair protein levels, making cancer cells more vulnerable to treatment.

articles.title: Berberine as a Multi-Targeted Therapeutic Agent in Melanoma: Mechanisms, Efficacy, and Combination Therapies.
articles.summary: Berberine shows promise in melanoma treatment by targeting multiple cancer pathways, inhibiting cell growth, promoting cell death, and enhancing immune responses.

articles.title: Organic cation transporter 1 and cytochrome P450s play crucial roles in coptisine- and worenine-induced hepatotoxicity.
articles.summary: Organic cation transporter 1 and cytochrome P450 enzymes contribute to liver toxicity caused by isoquinoline alkaloids coptisine and worenine.

articles.title: Development of palmatine chloride-loaded chitosan nanoparticles for enhanced and safe cervical cancer therapy.
articles.summary: Researchers developed chitosan nanoparticles loaded with palmatine chloride that effectively target and kill cervical cancer cells through apoptosis and oxidative stress.

articles.title: Synergistic effects of Coptis rhizome and rhubarb in inhibiting MDA-MB-231 triple-negative breast cancer metastasis: Potential involvement of coptisine and resveratroloside.
articles.summary: In a promising breast cancer study, Coptis rhizome and rhubarb extracts synergistically reduced triple-negative breast cancer metastasis through complementary molecular interactions.

articles.title: Berberine triggers apoptosis through the PI3K/Akt pathways and Nrf2 by inducing ROS in papillary thyroid cancer.
articles.summary: Berberine reduces Nrf2 levels and induces programmed cell death in papillary thyroid cancer by increasing reactive oxygen species.

articles.title: Proanthocyanidins inhibit CYP1B1 through mixed-type kinetics and stable binding in molecular dynamics simulations.
articles.summary: Proanthocyanidins effectively inhibit the CYP1B1 enzyme involved in cancer progression by blocking key enzyme interactions and binding sites.

articles.title: The role of oral microbiota in lung carcinogenesis through the oral-lung axis: a comprehensive review of mechanisms and therapeutic potential.
articles.summary: Oral bacteria may influence lung cancer development through microbial interactions and migration between the mouth and lungs, potentially offering new insights for prevention and treatment.

articles.title: Berberine protects against gefitinib-induced liver injury by inhibiting the HMGB1/TLR4/NF-κB pathway.
articles.summary: Berberine reduces liver damage caused by the lung cancer drug gefitinib by blocking a specific inflammatory pathway.

articles.title: Aspartic acid residues in BBE-like enzymes from Morus alba promote a function shift from oxidative cyclization to dehydrogenation.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered that specific aspartic acid residues in Morus alba enzymes can shift a reaction pathway from cyclization to dehydrogenation.

articles.title: Synergistic Mechanisms of Traditional Chinese Medicine and Proteasome Inhibitors in Multiple Myeloma Therapy: A Comprehensive Review.
articles.summary: Traditional Chinese medicine compounds could enhance proteasome inhibitor effectiveness and reduce side effects in multiple myeloma treatment, potentially improving patient outcomes.

articles.title: Exploring therapeutic targets in Toll-like receptor pathways: Implications for cardiovascular management in polycystic ovary syndrome.
articles.summary: Targeting specific Toll-like receptor pathways, particularly TLR2 and TLR4, could help manage cardiovascular complications associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS).

articles.title: Pharmacological properties and therapeutic potential of berberine: a comprehensive review.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Berberine, a plant-derived alkaloid, shows promising anti-cancer properties and potential therapeutic benefits across multiple disease systems with minimal side effects.

articles.title: Reversed-Phase High-Performance Liquid Chromatography Assisted Simultaneous Estimation and Validation as per ICHQ2(R2) Guidelines: Application of Method in Quantification of Paclitaxel and Berberine in Liposomes-Based Delivery System.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a reliable method to simultaneously measure paclitaxel and berberine in liposomes, enabling more effective breast cancer drug delivery analysis.

articles.title: Mechanistic Perspectives on Radiation-Induced Skin Injury and the Protective Effects of Berberine.
articles.summary: Berberine shows potential in protecting skin from radiation damage during cancer treatment by reducing inflammation and oxidative stress.

articles.title: Metformin and berberine synergistically improve NAFLD via the AMPK-SREBP1-FASN signaling pathway.
articles.summary:
Here's a summary sentence:

Metformin and berberine together effectively reduced fatty liver disease progression by activating a key metabolic pathway and improving liver fat metabolism.

articles.title: Palmatine inhibits colorectal cancer proliferation and metastasis by regulating miR-363-3p/AURKA axis.
articles.summary: Palmatine inhibits colorectal cancer growth by increasing miR-363-3p levels, which blocks AURKA protein production and reduces cancer cell spread.

articles.title: Tianma Granules Alleviate AOM/DSS-Induced Colorectal Tumorigenesis by Inhibiting the Wnt/β-Catenin Pathway Activation.
articles.summary: Tianma granules effectively reduced colorectal cancer progression in mice by inhibiting inflammation and disrupting key cancer-promoting cellular pathways.

articles.title: Unveiling Tetrahydroberberine-1,3,4-Oxadiazole hybrids as potent anticancer agents and MMP-9 inhibitors with comprehensive insights from in silico, in vitro, and ex vivo permeation studies.
articles.summary: A novel Tetrahydroberberine-1,3,4-oxadiazole hybrid (compound 10g) demonstrates significant anticancer potential by selectively inhibiting MMP9 in colorectal cancer cells.

articles.title: Berberine as a natural immunomodulator of B lymphocytes.
articles.summary: Berberine naturally inhibits and modulates pathological B lymphocyte functions, potentially offering therapeutic benefits in inflammatory, autoimmune, and B cell-related disorders.

articles.title: Exploring alkaloids and flavonoids from natural sources: Emerging natural agents for inhibiting cervical cancer progression through apoptosis induction, anti-inflammatory effects, and oxidative stress reduction.
articles.summary: Natural compounds like berberine and quercetin show promise in targeting cervical cancer by inducing cell death, reducing inflammation, and neutralizing oxidative stress.

articles.title: Jujuboside A induces bladder cancer cell apoptosis by inhibiting ATP1A2-mediated mitochondrial energy metabolism regulation.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Jujuboside A, a natural compound, effectively kills bladder cancer cells by disrupting their energy production mechanisms.

articles.title: Do games work? A meta-analytic synthesis of gamified learning for clinical reasoning in medical and allied health education.
articles.summary: Gamified learning interventions showed moderate improvement in clinical reasoning skills for medical and allied health students compared to traditional teaching methods.

articles.title: Genetic relationships between the gut microbiota and prostate cancer: Mendelian randomization combined with bioinformatics analysis.
articles.summary: A genetic study suggests a potential connection between gut bacteria composition and prostate cancer risk, pointing to new avenues for understanding disease development.

articles.title: Unregulated use of Artemisia in cancer patients in Libya: an emerging ethical and public health concern.
articles.summary: In Libya, cancer patients are increasingly using unregulated Artemisia herbal remedies from social media, risking potential interactions with standard cancer treatments.

articles.title: Multi-platform analysis of the tumor immune microenvironment associated with breast cancer subtypes.
articles.summary: A comprehensive analysis revealed distinct immune cell infiltration patterns across breast cancer subtypes, with Basal-like tumors showing the most complex and rich immune microenvironment.

articles.title: metaFun: An analysis pipeline for metagenomic big data with fast and unified functional searches.
articles.summary: metaFun is a comprehensive computational pipeline that streamlines metagenomic analysis, validated using a colorectal cancer dataset to improve research reproducibility.

articles.title: Radiotherapy-induced abscopal effects in immune checkpoint inhibitor-refractory metastatic disease: results from a large multicenter real-world cohort study.
articles.summary: In metastatic cancer patients, combining radiotherapy with immunotherapy can trigger systemic tumor responses, improving survival especially in younger patients with longer treatment intervals.

articles.title: DNA prime and peptide boost immunization elicits robust neoantigen-specific CD8 + T cell responses and therapeutic protection in mouse tumor models.
articles.summary: A DNA prime-peptide boost immunization strategy effectively activated T-cells and showed promising therapeutic effects against melanoma and lymphoma in mouse models.

articles.title: Evaluating carboplatin and PARP inhibitor combination efficacy using high-grade serous carcinoma spheroids and organoids.
articles.summary: In high-grade serous carcinoma, combining carboplatin with PARP inhibitors shows promise in targeting DNA repair deficiencies and potentially improving treatment outcomes.

articles.title: Development and validation of a nomogram for the overall survival of patients with locally advanced prostate cancer treated with radiotherapy and surgery.
articles.summary: A personalized predictive tool was developed to help doctors estimate survival outcomes for older patients with advanced prostate cancer receiving radiotherapy and surgery.

articles.title: Gut-lung axis and microbiome alterations in mycobacterial infections: from pathogenesis to therapeutic potential.
articles.summary: Mycobacterial lung infections are significantly influenced by gut-lung microbiome interactions, with potential therapeutic strategies involving probiotics and microbiome restoration.

articles.title: PhenoAgeAccel mediates the association between metabolic syndrome and cancer risk in males: a cross-sectional NHANES study.
articles.summary: In males, metabolic syndrome's link to cancer risk appears to be mediated by accelerated biological aging as measured by PhenoAgeAccel.

articles.title: Oncolytic virus OVV-03 enhances CAR-T cell therapy against glioblastoma via immune modulation and specific HER2 upregulation.
articles.summary: OVV-03, a novel oncolytic virus, enhances CAR-T cell therapy for glioblastoma by modulating the immune environment and improving T cell infiltration.

articles.title: The LXRβ/NF-κB axis reprograms CAR-T cells to resist exhaustion in the tumor microenvironment.
articles.summary: Researchers found that manipulating LXRβ and NF-κB signaling can enhance CAR-T cell performance against solid tumors by preventing exhaustion and improving anti-tumor activity.

articles.title: Unlocking the therapeutic potential of immuno-radiotherapy: insights from preclinical and clinical research.
articles.summary: Radiotherapy combined with immunotherapy shows promise for cancer treatment, but optimal strategies depend on carefully coordinated dose, timing, and radiation parameters.

articles.title: Endometrial receptivity in polycystic ovary syndrome: altered biomarkers and underlying mechanisms.
articles.summary: PCOS patients show altered endometrial markers that may reduce fertility by disrupting the conditions needed for successful embryo implantation.

articles.title: Tamoxifen induced hepatotoxicity via gut microbiota-mediated hyodeoxycholic acid depletion and Farnesoid X receptor signaling disruption.
articles.summary: Tamoxifen disrupts gut bacteria and bile acid metabolism, causing liver damage in breast cancer treatment, which can be mitigated by hyodeoxycholic acid supplementation.

articles.title: Clostridium butyricum alleviates multiple myeloma by remodeling the bone marrow microenvironment and inhibiting PI3K/AKT pathway through the gut‒bone axis.
articles.summary: Clostridium butyricum reduces multiple myeloma tumor burden by modulating bone marrow inflammation and inducing cancer cell death through metabolic pathways.

articles.title: Lenvatinib potentiates the antitumor efficacy of combined radiotherapy and PD-L1 blockade in lung adenocarcinoma.
articles.summary: Lenvatinib enhances the effectiveness of radiation and immunotherapy in treating lung adenocarcinoma by improving cancer cell destruction and immune response.

articles.title: Exploring the key functions of T cells and the regulation of the immune microenvironment in prostate cancer using single-cell RNA sequencing and bulk RNA sequencing.
articles.summary: Single-cell analysis of T cells in prostate cancer reveals key marker genes and immune interactions that could improve understanding of tumor progression and treatment.

articles.title: Single-cell landscape of peripheral and tumor-infiltrating immune cells in HPV-negative HNSCC.
articles.summary: Single-cell analysis reveals immune cell exhaustion and suppressive interactions in HPV-negative head and neck cancer, highlighting potential immunotherapy targets.

articles.title: Folate-targeted gold nanoparticles for doxorubicin delivery in tumor spheroids.
articles.summary: Folate-targeted gold nanoparticles effectively delivered doxorubicin to cancer cells, improving drug targeting and reducing toxic side effects.

articles.title: A dual diacylglycerol kinase (DGK) alpha/zeta inhibitor augments the activity of human tumor infiltrating lymphocytes in in vivo and ex vivo models.
articles.summary: A DGK inhibitor enhances tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte function and anti-tumor activity in non-small cell lung and head and neck cancer models.

articles.title: Downregulation of the lncRNA PGM5P4-AS1 predicts poor prognosis and drives breast cancer progression through miR-3664-5p/KLF9.
articles.summary: In breast cancer, reduced levels of the long RNA molecule PGM5P4-AS1 are linked to worse patient outcomes and tumor growth through a specific molecular pathway.

articles.title: Expression of EMMPRIN as a biomarker in nonodontogenic carcinomas: a histological study.
articles.summary: In oral nonodontogenic carcinomas, high EMMPRIN expression correlates with increased tumor growth, blood vessel formation, and potential for spreading.

articles.title: The role of gut microbiome in aging-associated diseases: where do we stand now and how technology will transform the future.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Advanced technologies are revealing how gut microbiome changes contribute to multiple age-related diseases, potentially enabling targeted interventions.

articles.title: Gut‒heart axis: emerging therapies targeting trimethylamine N-oxide production.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered TMA lyase inhibitors can reduce TMAO levels, potentially improving cardiovascular health and offering promising therapeutic interventions for multiple diseases.

articles.title: Inflammatory mechanisms and targeted drugs in heart failure.
articles.summary: Persistent cardiac inflammation, particularly through excessive NLRP3 inflammasome activation, plays a critical role in heart failure progression and myocardial damage.

articles.title: Assessing progesterone receptor modulation in glioblastoma: from in vitro and animal model to a human pilot protocol.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Mifepristone, a contraceptive drug, shows potential for treating glioblastoma by modulating progesterone receptor activity and potentially improving patient survival.

articles.title: A machine-learning informed circulating microbial DNA signature for early diagnosis of esophageal adenocarcinoma.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a machine learning-based blood test using microbial DNA that can accurately detect early-stage esophageal adenocarcinoma with 91% accuracy.

articles.title: Interaction between ZMIZ2 and AR promotes prostate cancer proliferation in vitro and in vivo.
articles.summary: ZMIZ2 protein enhances prostate cancer growth by interacting with androgen receptor and increasing genes that stimulate cell multiplication.

articles.title: PI3Kγ inhibition drives M1 macrophage differentiation and synergizes with PD-L1 blockade to improve survival in poorly immunogenic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
articles.summary: Blocking PI3Kη and PD-L1 in head and neck cancer transforms immune cells, potentially improving patient survival by enhancing the body's anti-tumor response.

articles.title: Polymersome-based nanomedicine for combined cancer therapy.
articles.summary: Polymersomes offer a promising nanomedicine approach for delivering multiple cancer treatments simultaneously, potentially improving therapy effectiveness and reducing side effects.

articles.title: Akkermansia muciniphila outer membrane protein Amuc_0904 modulates intestinal homeostasis by promoting goblet cell differentiation.
articles.summary: A specific outer membrane protein from Akkermansia muciniphila promotes goblet cell growth and protects against colitis and colorectal cancer in mice.

articles.title: Nanotherapeutics for enhanced treatments for ovarian cancer: a comprehensive minireview.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Nanotherapeutics offer promising targeted drug delivery strategies to improve ovarian cancer treatment and overcome limitations of current therapeutic approaches.

articles.title: Identification of coilin in bone marrow as a potential neuroblastoma tumor progression marker transcriptionally regulated by MYCN.
articles.summary: In neuroblastoma, increased coilin levels in bone marrow may indicate tumor progression and serve as a potential new diagnostic marker.

articles.title: Hydrogel-Based intraperitoneal drug delivery platforms for peritoneal metastasis: strategies, advances, and prospects.
articles.summary: Hydrogel-based drug delivery platforms can improve peritoneal metastasis treatment by enhancing local drug concentration and reducing systemic toxicity during intraperitoneal administration.

articles.title: Tumor microenvironment-responsive conformational activation of apoA-I mimetic peptides for targeted cancer therapy.
articles.summary: A novel peptide designed to activate only in tumors can selectively target and disrupt cancer cell membranes, inhibiting breast tumor growth by up to 71%.

articles.title: Preoperative mFOLFIRINOX versus PAXG for stage I-III resectable and borderline resectable pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PACT-21 CASSANDRA): results of the first randomisation analysis of a randomised, open-label, 2 × 2 factorial phase 3 trial.
articles.summary: For patients with early-stage pancreatic cancer, the chemotherapy combination PAXG did not prove superior to mFOLFIRINOX in improving treatment outcomes.

articles.title: Efficacy and safety of allogeneic CD19 CAR NK-cell therapy in systemic lupus erythematosus: a case series in China.
articles.summary: Allogeneic CD19 CAR NK-cell therapy showed promising potential for treating relapsed or refractory systemic lupus erythematosus with potentially improved safety compared to CAR T-cell approaches.

articles.title: Clinical outcomes of metastatic non-clear cell renal cell carcinoma: a real-world single-centre experience.
articles.summary: In patients with metastatic non-clear cell kidney cancer, immunotherapy combined with targeted therapy showed potentially improved clinical outcomes compared to targeted therapy alone.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary: A traditional Chinese herbal medicine (Gushen Antai recipe) may improve early pregnancy outcomes by positively influencing plasma cytokine levels in IVF patients.

articles.title: Toward next-generation therapeutic HPV vaccines: A review on expanding the antigen repertoire and an integrated bioinformatics selection framework.
articles.summary: A comprehensive review proposes expanding HPV vaccine antigens beyond traditional targets to include tumor-specific neoantigens for more effective therapeutic cancer treatments.

articles.title: Machine learning-assisted detection of canine mammary tumors using serum autoantibody signatures.
articles.summary: A machine learning model using blood autoantibody signatures can accurately detect canine mammary tumors, offering a promising noninvasive diagnostic approach.

articles.title: Leveraging machine learning to predict de novo skin malignancy following lung transplantation.
articles.summary:
Here's a summary sentence:

Machine learning analysis revealed key clinical and genetic factors that predict skin cancer risk in lung transplant patients.

articles.title: Prolonged progression-free survival with zanubrutinib in relapsed/refractory CLL: an indirect treatment comparison versus other BTK inhibitors using multilevel network meta-regression.
articles.summary: Zanubrutinib showed superior progression-free survival compared to other BTK inhibitors in patients with relapsed/refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

articles.title: Development and preliminary validation of a PICC-related venous thrombosis risk prediction model for cancer patients: A systematic review and meta-analysis predominantly based on Chinese populations.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a prediction model to assess the risk of blood clots in cancer patients using centrally inserted catheters, primarily based on Chinese population data.

articles.title: Development and implementation of a supportive care model for cancer patients in the last days of life: A hospital-based program.
articles.summary: The study developed a hospital-based supportive care program for terminally ill cancer patients in China to improve end-of-life care quality and family satisfaction.

articles.title: Awareness of the link between HPV and cancer according to cancer type and gender in the US from 2014-2020.
articles.summary: US adults' awareness of HPV's link to cervical cancer decreased over time, while awareness of HPV's connection to other cancers remained low across genders.

articles.title: Comparative analysis of three different serum-free light chain assays in the diagnosis of multiple myeloma.
articles.summary: A new blood test method (KHB assay) was evaluated as a potentially more accurate way to detect free light chains in multiple myeloma diagnosis.

articles.title: Construction of a diagnostic model for tuberculosis based on long non-coding RNA.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a machine learning model using long non-coding RNA markers to potentially improve tuberculosis diagnosis through non-sputum samples.

articles.title: The making of multispecific immunoglobulins - a clinical perspective.
articles.summary: Multispecific antibodies are emerging as versatile cancer therapeutics that can simultaneously target multiple antigens, enhancing immune cell redirection and treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Disease-related communication difficulties and dyadic coping among patients with breast cancer and their spouses: An actor-partner interdependence model.
articles.summary: Breast cancer patients and their spouses who communicate more effectively about the disease experience better mutual support and coping strategies.

articles.title: Managing psychological distress in women with breast cancer: A systematic review of intervention trends in the past decade.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Recent studies show that tailored psychological interventions can effectively reduce anxiety and depression in breast cancer survivors.

articles.title: Best evidence summary on gastrointestinal function recovery after radical cystectomy for bladder cancer.
articles.summary: Early mobilization and enhanced recovery protocols significantly improve gastrointestinal function and recovery time for patients undergoing bladder cancer surgical removal.

articles.title: Development and Validation of Nomograms to Predict Overall Survival and Cancer-Specific Survival for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer with Chest Wall Invasion: A Retrospective Study Based on SEER Database.
articles.summary: Researchers developed prediction tools to estimate survival chances for lung cancer patients with chest wall invasion by analyzing key risk factors.
